overview.projectDescription: Convert existing single detached home into a 7-unit residential multiplex

currentState.framing: Interior walls stripped to framing on ground floor and basement. Framing mostly complete with some additional work remaining.

scopeExclusions: No exterior work beyond roof replacement and garage conversion
No underpinning or structural wall removals

sections.title: Soundproofing
sections.description: Soundproofing (resilient channel, damping, double Type X, sealing).

sections.title: Insulation
sections.description: Continuous insulation + cavity insulation on ground floor; basement floor insulation assembly.

sections.title: Drywall
sections.description: All drywall installation across ground floor and basement units, including ceilings and partition walls.

sections.title: Interior Finishes
sections.description: Tile, flooring, underlayment, waterproofing, trims, transitions.

sections.title: Tenant Services
sections.description: Intercom/doorbell for 7 endpoints + structured wiring to avoid future wall cuts; basic electrical coordination.

Prepare permit drawings + scope package for multiplex conversion
items.description: Assemble the permit set, including unit layouts, life-safety approach, mechanical/plumbing/electrical notes, and required details for a Toronto multiplex conversion.
items.note: Include fire separations/alarms/egress strategy early so downstream assemblies are not reworked.

items.title: Ground floor walls: continuous insulation layer
items.description:
Install continuous insulation (interior/exterior as designed) and integrate air/vapour control layers.

This is the description
items.note: Confirm thickness/spec and fastening strategy; ensure continuity at transitions and openings.

items.title: Ground floor walls: 2x4 cavity insulation + vapour/air sealing
items.description: Install cavity insulation (batts or spray foam per design/fire requirements) and complete vapour barrier and sealing where applicable.
items.note: Coordinate with electrical/plumbing rough-ins to avoid gaps and compression.

items.title: Basement floor insulation system
items.description: Install basement floor insulation assembly (rigid foam/subfloor panels/sleepers as designed) including vapour/underlayment strategy.
items.note: Confirm moisture management and floor height impacts with door/stair transitions.

materials.name: Rigid foam / subfloor panels / sleepers (per design)

items.title: Full plumbing rework (DWV + water distribution)
items.description: Redo plumbing: drain/waste/vent, water distribution, cleanouts, valves, manifolds, and unit shutoffs.
items.note: Plan for 7 kitchens total; bathrooms/laundry per final design. Coordinate penetrations + firestopping.

items.title: Heat pump system planning (multi-zone) + install allowances
items.description: Define heat pump approach (outdoor units + indoor heads/air handlers), routing, mounting, line sets, and service clearances.
items.note: Include condensate drainage plan and electrical coordination early.

materials.name: Electrical disconnects and whips (coordinate with electrical)

items.title: Optional: gas backup heating allowances (if pursued)
items.description: If you decide to include gas backup heating, plan furnace/coil integration and gas venting/piping after final HVAC design.
items.note: Keep as conditional scope until design is locked.

items.title: Bathroom exhaust venting (all bathrooms)
items.description: Install exhaust fans, insulated ducting, terminations, dampers, and sealing for all bathrooms per layout.
items.note: Coordinate routes early to avoid conflicts with framing and rated assemblies.

items.title: Kitchen hood venting (all kitchens)
items.description: Provide ducted kitchen hood venting sized per hood specs with proper terminations and dampers; plan make-up air if required.
items.note: Prefer smooth metal duct where required; confirm termination locations with roof scope.

materials.name: Kitchen hood ducting sized per hood specs

items.title: Air sealing around penetrations (rated + non-rated)
items.description: Seal penetrations with fire-rated products where needed and standard sealing elsewhere; coordinate with fire/sound assemblies.
items.note: Track every penetration through rated assemblies to avoid missed firestopping.

items.title: Basement ceiling: resilient channel + damping + double 5/8 Type X
items.description: Sound isolation and fire-rated ceiling assembly including resilient channels, damping layer, double Type X drywall, sealing, and penetration treatment.
items.note: Confirm exact assembly requirements with the permit set and inspection requirements.

materials.name: Drywall screws (correct length for layers + channels)
Putty pads for electrical boxes (if used)

items.title: Tile package (wet areas and as designed)
items.description: Tile materials and install consumables for bathrooms/kitchens/backsplashes as designed.

items.title: Flooring package (basement + ground floor as designed)
items.description: Non-tile flooring materials plus underlayment, transitions, trims, and moisture layers where required.

items.title: Remove garage door and build infill wall with window

items.title: Install two exterior entrance doors for different units

items.title: Tenant entry / delivery intercom (7 endpoints)

units.name: Unit 7 - Back (1 Bd)
units.description:
This unit has access to the existing bathroom in the basement. This unit is on the right side of the stair case going down to the basement. For this unit, we need to move the walls of the existing bedroom (so we need to build 2 sides of the wall for the bedroom (10' on one side and 8' on the other) There is also a side to the outside wall that requires proper insulation (rigid foam + 2X4 + batt).
There was an existing window in this unit which was closed by the previous owner and we should open it again. 
We need to plan for a kitchen in this unit for the future expansion plan.

units.name: Unit 6 - Center (Bachelor)
units.description:
We need to build a kitchen and a bathroom for this unit. The existing furnace is now in this unit which needs to be removed. The bathroom is going to be build in the place of the current Furnace.
There is a wall of 12' 4" separating this unit from unit 5 which needs to be properly sound insulated. The kitchen of unit 6 is placed against this wall.

units.name: Unit 5 - Front (1bd)
units.description:
This unit is the one on the left side of the stairs. The bedroom will be built in the next stage of development. 
Currently we need to build the bathroom in the existing Cold storage. The cold storage has 3 sides which are connected directly to the outside so proper insulation is required. I'd like to do 2" continuous Rigid foam on 3 sides + 2X2 Framing + 2" rigid foam in the cavity to save space instead of the 2X4 + bat insulation. The bathroom is connected to the main living room on the longer side (16' 7" doesn't need too much insulation so on this side, we can fill the 2X2 with thinner batt to save cost or keep the entire place with rigid foam).
Also, we need to plan for a kitchen in this unit for the next phase of the development.

units.name: Unit 4 - Back Bachelor
units.description:
This is a very small bachelor unit. The entrance is from the back yard. The entrance is adjacent to Unit 3. For this unit we need to build a new bathroom and kitchen. 
Since this unit is very small, the insulation for the outside walls in this unit will have to be 2" continuous rigid foam + 2 X 2 framing + 2" rigid foam in the cavity (instead of Bats). This should run on the outside wall (11' 6" on one side and 14' 5" on the other side with a height of 8'). The other sides of this unit is adjacent to the bathroom of unit 3 and the living room of unit 3. The living room side must be properly sound insulated (wall length: 11' 6")
There is good natural light in this unit (window size: 1.6square meters)

units.name: Unit 3 - Back (1 bd)
units.description:
We need to create the entrance door for this unit. We also need to build stairs that will provide access for this unit as well as the other bachelor unit that is located at the back. The entrance to this unit and the other unit are side by side so one stair can service both. 
This unit is using the existing bathroom on the ground floor so we don't need to build a new bathroom for this unit but we need to add washer and dryer for this unit. 
This unit is sharing walls with the Bachelor unit from the back (Unit 4) and also with the bedroom of Unit 1.
We need extensive sound insulation for this unit.

units.name: Unit 2 - Garage (1 Bd)
units.description:
Garage conversion to livable space. Currently non-livable with no plumbing. The garage door (9' × 8' opening) will be replaced with a proper wall and window. A 3-step stair connects the garage to the main building, with a doorway to be opened. The garage floor is cement with a slope towards the outside that must be corrected (approach TBD). The bedroom is a separate enclosed space accessed via the stairs connecting to the main house.

Insulation & shared walls:
- Two exterior walls require insulation (2" rigid foam + 2×4 framing with batt): 19' and 9' walls, both ~12' ceiling height.
- Ceiling requires insulation.
- One shared wall with Unit 1 (cement) — no soundproofing required.

rooms.description: Main garage open space, open concept with kitchen.

units.name: Unit 1 - Front (1 Bd)
units.description:
Entrance from the front of the property via existing wooden stairs (replacement stairs not yet planned). The entrance leads to an open-concept living room/kitchen area. The unit has one bedroom and one new-build bathroom.

Insulation & shared walls:
- Left side exterior walls in the living room require insulation (2" rigid foam + 2×4 framing with batt insulation): one wall 16'6" × 8' and one wall 10' × 8'.
- Right side living room wall is shared with Unit 2 (garage) — standard sound insulation sufficient.
- Bedroom shares a 12' wall with Unit 3's bedroom (back-to-back) — requires heavy-duty sound insulation.

rooms.description: Open concept with kitchen. Left side exterior walls require insulation (2" rigid foam + 2×4 with batt): 16'6" wall and 10' wall. Right side wall shared with Unit 2 (garage), standard sound insulation.
Private bedroom. Shares one wall (12') with Unit 3's bedroom — requires heavy-duty sound insulation.
Open concept within the living area. L-shaped layout (10' × 6'). Gas burner. All appliances provided except dishwasher. Plumbing needs to be planned.
New build. 3-piece bathroom with standing shower and simple vanity.
